info.title: Cybersecurity Awareness Quiz
info.description: This quiz tests your knowledge on cybersecurity best practices for corporate employees.

questions.question: What is the most common way cybercriminals gain access to corporate systems?
options: Guessing employee usernames
Sending phishing emails
Hacking into the company’s main server directly
Asking employees for their credentials in person

questions.question: You receive an email from your company’s IT department asking you to verify your account by clicking a link. What should you do?
options: Click the link immediately and follow the instructions
Reply to the email with your username and password
Check the sender’s email address and contact IT separately to verify
Ignore the email and delete it without reporting
questions.answer: Check the sender’s email address and contact IT separately to verify

questions.question: Why is it important to use unique passwords for different accounts?
options: It makes logging in more fun
If one password is compromised, other accounts remain secure
It confuses hackers and prevents them from guessing your password
It is required by corporate policy, but it doesn’t improve security
questions.answer: If one password is compromised, other accounts remain secure

questions.question: What is Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)?
options: Logging in using your email and a backup email
Using multiple passwords for the same account
A security feature that requires additional verification (e.g., a code sent to your phone)
An advanced firewall that prevents all cyber attacks
questions.answer: A security feature that requires additional verification (e.g., a code sent to your phone)

questions.question: Which of the following passwords is the strongest?
options: Password123
P@ssw0rd
JjY!9r$2&Xq#
CompanyName2024

questions.question: What should you do if you suspect your work computer is infected with malware?
options: Ignore the issue and continue working
Try to delete suspicious files yourself
Contact the IT department immediately and follow their instructions
Restart your computer and hope the problem goes away
questions.answer: Contact the IT department immediately and follow their instructions

questions.question: What is a common sign of a phishing attempt?
options: The email is from a well-known sender and looks professional
The message creates a sense of urgency and asks you to act quickly
The email contains no links or attachments
The sender is your colleague and uses proper grammar
questions.answer: The message creates a sense of urgency and asks you to act quickly

questions.question: You’re using a public Wi-Fi network at a coffee shop to check work emails. What is the best way to keep your data secure?
options: Ensure the Wi-Fi network requires a password to connect
Use a VPN (Virtual Private Network) before accessing work resources
Only visit HTTPS websites
Log in quickly and disconnect as soon as you finish
questions.answer: Use a VPN (Virtual Private Network) before accessing work resources

questions.question: What is the best practice for handling work-related confidential documents?
options: Save them on your personal cloud storage for easy access
Print them and store them in your desk drawer
Share them over email with anyone who requests them
Store them in a secure, company-approved location with restricted access
questions.answer: Store them in a secure, company-approved location with restricted access

questions.question: A coworker asks you to share your login credentials because they forgot theirs. What should you do?
options: Give them your login credentials temporarily since they are a trusted coworker
Report the incident to IT, as sharing credentials is against company policy
Write your credentials down for them so they can log in
Log in for them and let them use your computer
questions.answer: Report the incident to IT, as sharing credentials is against company policy
